post.author: linnx88
post.body:
Hello,

I have worked with gmax for a while and created quiet a few models in it as I was learning. Now i finally managed to get a hold of max 5.1 full version and wanted to know if there's a script out there or a proggy that'll let me convert a .gmax file to .max. Please let me know.

post.author: kat
post.body:
there isn't an 'official' way to do it but you can work around the problem.

- The usual way is to export a model from gmax to one of the file formats that's included when you load up a gamepack, MD3 that comes with the Quake3 Tempest plugin for example.

- You then need to open that known format either directly by using an import plugin to MAX or convert it using one of the file converters that are floating around the web.

- There are limitaions though and they have to do with the MD3 format itself.... models can't be bigger than 1024x1024 otherwise they bork up, and you can't animate an MD3.

The other way to export is to output your gmax file to the *.pls (plasma) file format from gmax and again import that into MAX. I'm not 100% sure about this method though as the plasma format is really for the web.

post.author: jazzo
post.body:
linnx88 wrote:
Hello,

I have worked with gmax for a while and created quiet a few models in it as I was learning. Now i finally managed to get a hold of max 5.1 full version and wanted to know if there's a script out there or a proggy that'll let me convert a .gmax file to .max. Please let me know.


To make a this you can use program called 3D Exploration: 1. Make a model in gmax and export it in .MD3-format (there are many export-plug-in available). 2. Open 3D Exploration and use open/MD3. Then export model in .3DS-format (or DXF). Now open studio max and use import/.3DS.

But you can use Studio Max MD3.import-plug-in too.

In Studio Max use export/3DS. Then you can import that in gmax.

post.author: kat
post.body: .. or you can import the MD3 straight into Max if you add the MD3 import/export script

post.author: jazzo
post.body:
kat wrote:
.. or you can import the MD3 straight into Max if you add the MD3 import/export script


yeaah, baby! But 3D Exploration is a nise tool. There are many supported formats. There ar 57 format in import and 13 format in out. And its freeware.

post.author: kat
post.body: Yeah I know, I've got it myself.. very handy tool, but you have to search around the net for it as it's not generally avaiable

post.author: kat
post.body: http://www.quake3bits.com/htm/tutorials ... erting.htm
